intro: Biscutella apula var. lyrata, commonly known as the lyrated biscutella, is a rare flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a raceme, typically blooming in late spring. This variety is noted for its unique leaf morphology and is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution.
